annotated_adaptations.description: Add type annotations to the parameters and return type of the add_logging_level function for better type checking and readability.
Change function name from 'addLoggingLevel' to 'add_logging_level' to follow snake_case naming convention.
Add a new method 'adapterLog' to handle logging for LoggerAdapter instances.
Include a new attribute to add the custom logging method to LoggerAdapter instances.
Add explicit import of get_ipython from IPython to ensure the function works without prior imports.
Rename the function from 'is_notebook' to '_detect_ipython_zmq' for clarity and to indicate it is a private helper function.
Rename the method to 'get_class_by_tablename' to improve clarity and match naming conventions.
Modify the attribute used to access the class registry for a more suitable or correct reference.
Include a return statement to explicitly handle cases where no match is found.
Rename the parameter from 'kargs' to 'kwargs' for consistency and clarity.
Include an import statement for 'unittest.mock' to ensure the mock_open function has access to the unittest module.
Change the usage of the Popen function to correctly reference the Popen class from the subprocess module.
Update the stdout and stderr arguments to correctly reference the piping from the subprocess module.
Change the print statement to use parentheses for Python 3 compatibility.
Add a print statement to output the shell command line when a shell command fails.
Remove the conversion of output to a string before returning.
Add a type annotation to the 'arg' parameter to specify it as a string.
Change the method to be a class method and update the method signature accordingly.
Rename the method from 'remove_argument' to '_remove_argument'.
Update the parameter name from 'parser' to 'cls'.
Change the access of 'parser' to 'cls._parser' to reflect its usage as a class attribute.
Refactor the identifier 'action' to 'argument_group' for better readability and consistency.
Replace the direct function call, filter, with its full qualified name.
Replace the direct function call, isdir and join, with its full qualified name.
Add type annotations to the function parameters and return type for better type checking and readability.
Replace the numpy array conversion to string method with a simpler string conversion for 'a'.
Remove extra characters from the last line of the array string before joining the LaTeX lines.
Eliminate the temporary string variable 'temp_string' used for storing the formatted array string.
Rename the method to parse_by_group.
Add the flat argument to the Namespace creation to include all parsed arguments.
Replace 'input_.get_shape().as_list()' with a custom shape extraction function in the repository to handle dynamic tensor shape in tensorflow.
Add a '*' separator to enforce keyword-only arguments for the 'index' parameter.
Replace a bare 'except' clause with 'except Exception' to catch a general exception more explicitly.
Insert import errno statement inside the function to limit its scope for optimization.
Add type annotations to the function parameters and return type for better type checking and readability.
Rename the function from 'update' to 'update_dict' to provide a more descriptive function name.
Replace 'collections.abc.Mapping' with 'Mapping' considering the imports to improve namespace cleanliness.
Add type annotations to the function parameters and return type for better type checking and readability.
Renamed the function parameter from 't' to 'e' for clarity and consistency.
Add type annotations to the function parameters and return value for better type checking and readability.
Remove the conversion of the input array to a numpy array, assuming the input is already a numpy array.
Rename the parameter from 'array' to 'sorted_array' to improve clarity.
Rename the function from 'procrustes' to 'compute_similarity_transform'.
Add type annotations for parameters 'X' and 'Y' as 'np.ndarray'.
Rename 'scaling' parameter to 'compute_optimal_scale' and change its default value from True to False.
Delete the 'reflection' parameter for functional change.
Remove the variables 'n', 'm', 'ny', and 'my' that stores the shapes of 'X' and 'Y' and their corresponding logic.
Replace the in-place division with the straightforward division to scale 'X0' and 'Y0' to unit norm.
Remove the logic for handling reflection in the transformation.
Add logic to ensure 'T' is a proper rotation matrix by adjusting its determinant.
Change the return values to include 'd', 'Z', 'T', 'b', and 'c' instead of using a dictionary.
Add type annotations to the function parameter 'v' and return type 'bool' for better type checking and readability.
Expand the logic to recognize additional string representations of boolean values ('True', 'False').
Add a 'local_filename' parameter to allow specifying the local filename and remove the line that automatically generates it from the URL.
Modify the chunk_size parameter to None to allow for unbounded chunk sizes, which is more flexible for handling large files.
Change the function name 'update' to 'mapping_update_recursively' to match the second snippet.
Change the use of dict iterating api from Python 2.x to Python 3 by using 'items'.
Change the namespace of Mapping from 'collections' to 'collections.abc' because the module moving after Python 3.3.
Add type annotations to the function parameters and return type for better type checking and readability.
Replace the assertion for checking duplicate keys with an explicit 'else' clause that raises a ValueError if a duplicate key is found.
Rename the second variable in the 'node.value' to '_' for indicating it.
Rename the reused method to 'add_logging_level' for a better naming convention.
Rename all parameters from camelCase to snake_case for a consistent naming convention.
Change the method name to `rst2txt` for clarity and to reflect the function's purpose.
Change the parameter name from 'text' to 'source' to improve readability.
Insert a try-except block to catch and log exceptions during the conversion process.
Add import statements for all necessary imports in the function for better modularity and efficiency.
Add import statements for the Sphinx application to utilize its features within the function.
Cast the app to Sphinx type to integrate with Sphinx's builder and translator properly.
Suppress warnings during the building process using `catch_warnings`.
Include an events parameter in the app configuration to align with Sphinx's application structure.
Integrate the necessary logic of the main function to the `rst2txt` function for better structure and readability.
Rename the identifier `app` to `_app` to improve code readability and maintainability.
Change the return statement to return a string instead of printing the `translator.body` directly.
Convert the type of the return value to a string explicitly for better type checking.
Insert the import statements for the necessary dependencies for better efficiency.
Change the type conversion of the third dimension of the 'new' variable from using 'int' to 'float'.
Add type annotations to the parameters and return type of the '_remove_comment' method for better type checking and readability.
Rename the function from 'remove_comments' to '_remove_comments' to provide a more descriptive function name.
Refactor the condition of comment removal logic to use the 'walrus operator' for direct assignment and conditional check.
Modify the return value to preserve the number of newlines from the comment if comments are found.
Add type annotations to the parameters and return type of the inner method '_replacer' for better type checking and readability.
Insert If statement to handle the cases when the parameter 'keys' is a string. If so, split the string into a list by dots.
Add type annotations to the function parameters and return type for better type checking and readability.
Rename the function from 'stack_size2a' to 'stack_size' to provide a more descriptive function name.
Catch the ValueError and add a fallback return statement to handle cases where the call stack is not deep enough.
Encapsulate the code within a function named `escape_ansi_bytes` to make it reusable.
Add type annotations 'bytes' to the function parameters and return type for better type checking and readability.

Change the regex pattern in re.compile using a raw byte string literal. to match 7-bit and 8-bit C1 ANSI sequences. Specifically, it also includes a range of characters from hexadecimal 80 to 9A and 9C to 9F. And it matches either the escape sequence \x1B[ or \x9B.

Change the regex pattern to match 7-bit and 8-bit C1 ANSI sequences. Specifically:
1. It includes extended ASCII characters from hexadecimal 80 to 9A and 9C to 9F.
2. It includes both \x1B[ and \x9B control sequence introducer.
Directly return the result of the substitution to provide the expected output.
Rename the temporary variable 'ansi_escape' to 'ansi_escape_8bit' for clarity.
Rename the variable 'sometext' to 'input' to align with the function's parameter for clarity.
Rename the function from 'rotatedRectWithMaxArea' to '_getCropSize' to provide a more descriptive function name.
Add logic to convert the 'angle' varaibles from degrees to radians.
Change the order of the returned values to first return height and then width.
Change the function to a method in the 'RandomRotate' class by including 'self' as the first parameter.
Eliminate the validation check for non-positive width and height, which was originally present.
Encapsulate the code within a function named `fix_pyyaml` to make it reusable.
Rename the method from 'adjust_gamma' to 'adjust_gamma_of_image'.
Remove the astype conversion from the image parameter.
Move the astype conversion for the table array to be part of the array creation.
Rename the function from 'full_details_exception_handler' to 'custom_exception_handler' to provide a more descriptive function name.
Insert import 'exception_handler' from 'rest_framework.views' statement inside the function to limit its scope for optimization.
Change the function name from 'batch_norm' to 'batch_norm_template'.
Rename 'x', 'phase_train' to 'inputs' and 'is_training' to improve readibility.
Remove the 'n_out' from the parameters by calculating its value from 'inputs'.
Update the 'scope' parameter by removing its default value.
Introduce 'moments_dims' parameter to specify dimensions for moments calculation.
Introduce 'bn_decay' parameter to control moving average weight.
Add code to determine the number of channels from 'inputs' tensor shape.
Set decay to 'bn_decay' if provided, otherwise use default value 0.9.
Assign 'scope' variable as 'sc' within variable scope.
Update moments calculation to use 'moments_dims' parameter instead of a hardcoded list.
Set the decay argument with the calculated 'decay' in the ExponentialMovingAverage call
Calculate 'ema_apply_op' within a conditional context based on 'is_training'. If it is false, use 'tf.no_op()'.
Add type annotations to the function parameters and return type for better type checking and readability.
Rename the function from 'split' to 'list_split' for better clarity.
Rename the parameter from 'a' to 'l' to follow a different naming convention.
Change the generator expression to a list comprehension to return a list of lists instead of a generator.
Add type annotations to the function parameters and return type for better type checking and readability.
Change parameter names from 'var' to 'dict_' and 'keys' to 'key_', which only supports searching the value of a single key in the dict. The order of parameters should be 'key_, dict_'.
Remove the for statement that iterates 'keys' because of the parameter change.
Change the recursive call of 'gen_dict_extract' by removing the list wrapper around 'key' and changing the argument order.
Rename the function from 'min_sparse' to 'safe_min'.
Add a condition to check if the input is a sparse matrix using 'sparse.issparse(X)'.
Add an else clause to handle dense matrices by returning 'X.min()' when the input is not sparse.
Replace 'ceil' with 'math.ceil' to improve namespace cleanliness.
Encapsulate the code within a function named `remove_dir_content` to make it reusable.
Add a `directory` parameter to the function to specify the target directory and replace the 'folder' variable.
Remove the hardcoded `folder` variable to use the function parameter instead.
Change the return format from a formatted string to a tuple containing the size and the size name.
Add the `dtype` keyword argument to `tf.range` to ensure the data type consistency during the indexing operation.
Modify the return value to include the class itself in the set of all subclasses.
Encapsulate the code within a function named 'control_xml_utf8' with parameters 'filepath' and 'module'.
Add a check for 'HAS_LXML_LIBRARY' and handle errors using 'module.fail_json'.
Update the source file path to concatenate 'filepath' with 'control.xml'.
Add 'strip_cdata=False' to the XMLParser configuration.
Change the output file name from 'output.xml' to 'control_utf8.xml'.
Encapsulate the code that modifies the behavior of the 'ClassDocumenter' into a separate function 'mock_autodoc' to improve modularity and readability.
Apply the @override decorator to the `add_line` method to help with type checking.
Update the calculation of corner points by swapping the coordinates of bottom_right (i.e., bottom_right[0], bottom_right[1]) to ensure correct position referencing.
Update the corner_radius calculation to consider the minimum of height and width for better proportion.
Modify the function to return only the margin of error (h) instead of the mean and the confidence interval.
Remove the conditional statement to handle the boolean inputs.
Update the function name to '_split_every' to follow a specific naming convention.
Replace the direct call to 'islice' with 'itertools.islice' to maintain clarity on the function's origin and to ensure it is always clear that 'islice' is from 'itertools'.
The method signature is updated to include 'self' to be used as an instance method.
Change the method name from 'get_bearing' to 'headingBetween' for consistent naming convention in the class.
Remove semicolons at the end of statements which are not required in Python.
Change the call to 'math.degrees' instead of 'np.rad2deg' to transfer radian value to degrees since numpy is no longer imported.
Update the logic to normalize the negative bearing, where negative values are converted to positive by taking the absolute value instead of adding 360.
Insert the logic to normalize the positive bearing by subtracting it from 360.

Specify the return type of the function as a mutable set of strings and add a type annotation to the parameter for better type checking and readability.

Simplify the check for files within the directory by using 'any(files)' and continue statement.

Change the function name to snake_case to match the naming convention in Python.
Add initialization for lists to keep track of the positions and indices of nodes that are not removed during simplification.
Add an else clause to append the position and index of nodes that are not removed to their respective lists.
Modify the return statement to include additional information about the positions and indices of kept nodes.
Add type annotations to the function parameters and return type for better type checking and readability.
Specify the file encoding as UTF-8 when opening the Python file.
Add logic to check if 'node.module' is empty and, if so, set 'module' to an empty list.
Use 'hasattr()' function to check the node has a 'names' attribute before iterating over it.

Add type annotations to the function parameters and return type for better type checking and readability.

Remove a conditional check to apply the sieve algorithm only to potential prime numbers, optimizing the algorithm by skipping non-prime indices.

Add initialization of the warp matrix with a translation component set to zero.
Remove the timing code which was used for performance measurement in the original snippet.
Change the return type of the warp matrix to a PyTorch tensor for integration with PyTorch-based workflows.
Remove print statements that were used for debugging and performance tracking.

Rename local variable identifiers from 'img1' to 'im1', 'img2' to 'im2' and 'criteria' to 'criteria_' to match the new parameter names passed to the function.

Modify the instance reference from 'f' to 'self.game_state' to adapt the code to the new context.

Change variable 't' type from string to list, which is more efficient for concatenation operations in Python.

Change the exception type from a generic Exception to a more specific ValueError and provided a formatted message with the problematic line.

Rename the function from 'addLoggingLevel' to '_define_log_level' to provide a more descriptive function name.
Replace the use of string formatting with f-strings for clearer and more concise syntax in raising AttributeError.
Add a check for the type of the 'time' parameter and raises a ValueError if it is neither an integer nor a datetime object.
Change the parameter time from a default parameter to a positional one.
Add an optional 'now' parameter to define the reference point for the date comparison, with a default value of the current time.
Change the condition of 'day_diff' from 31 to 28.
When 'weeks' is 1, return a string 'a week ago' instead of 'str(day_diff // 7) weeks ago'.
When 'month' is 1 , return a string 'a month ago' instead of 'str(day_diff // 30) months ago'. And, When 'month' is 12 , add statement 'months -= 1' instead of 'str(day_diff // 30) months ago'
When 'diff' is 1, return a string 'a year ago' instead of 'str(diff) weeks ago'.
Add the condition to judge 'now' variable is 'None' instead of directly assignment.
When 'day_diff' is 1, return a string 'yesterday' instead of 'Yesterday'.

This regular expression matches strings that start with 'version_', followed by a version number consisting of three digits separated by dots, possibly followed by a hyphen and any character. It adds double quotes '"' to separate the version number from the rest of the string.

This lambda function is used to replace matched version strings. It connects the matched quotes '"' or '"' with the new version 'new_version' to form the new version string, while retaining the original quotes.

Remove the parameter 'a' in the method signature and using 'sizes' to initialize it in the method body.

Iterate all convex hull points to calculate vectors between each point (edges) and angles between vectors. The results are stored in lists.

Append the calculated minimum bounding rectangle as a Shapely Polygon to the `mbr_list`, instead of numpy.array.
Append the resulting minimum bounding rectangles to a list instead of returning a single result, to support multiple geometries.
